author: casalacolina-jt
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Compile this test app (x64/Release) and place the .exe on machine B.

```
#include <iostream>
#include <windows.h>
#include <shlwapi.h>

int main()
{
LONG r = ::PathIsDirectory(L"\\\\MachineA\\ABC\\DEF\\");
std::cout << "result is " << r << std::endl;
return 0;
}
```
2. On machine A, define the UNC share \\MachineA\ABC\DEF and confirm that it is accessible from machine B.
3. From machine A, use Enter-PSSession to start a remote session on machine B
4. Run the app in the remote session.
5. I get a result of 0. Expected result is 16.

### Expected behavior

```console
PathIsDirectory should return 16
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PathIsDirectory returns 0
```


### Environment data


comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
This is a double-hop issue, I think. When in a remote session you can't use implicit credentials to access another machine remotely. You need to provide explicit credentials. I'm not super familiar how that's done in .NET, but in PS you would define a new PSDrive with `New-PSDrive` pointing to the remote host and supply a `-Credential` to authenticate.

This is a Windows remoting limitation, not something intrinsic to PowerShell, as far as I understand.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winrm/multi-hop-support
Multi-Hop Support in WinRM - Win32 apps
Windows Remote Management (WinRM) supports the delegation of user credentials across multiple remote computers.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: PathIsDirectory() with UNC path fails in a WinRM remote session
